template.p: Effectively managing your sales process starts with a good system. By using a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) app, you can easily track contacts, manage communications, and generate professional quotations. The CRM's built-in tools allow you to customize prices for each client, turning generic products into personalized solutions.

h3.b: Creating a Sales Order from the CRM

template.p: Follow these steps to generate a new sales order directly from your CRM app:

li.p: Create an Opportunity: Click "Create" to start a new sales opportunity.
Select a Client: Choose an existing customer from your list or add a new one directly into the customer field.
Communicate and Understand Needs: Use the chatter feature to communicate with the client. This helps you clarify their specific requirements for the project.
Generate a Quotation: Once you understand their needs, generate a quotation from the opportunity.

Build the Quote: Select a quotation template, add the required products and any extra services. Use the quote calculator to price each item based on the customer's specifications. The product tabs are organized by their sequence on the sales lines.
Add Project Management: Add the "Carpentry project" service to track the entire quotation within a dedicated project.
Finalize Details: Update the delivery date to ensure deadlines are met and deliveries are scheduled correctly.
Send the Quote: Send the final quotation to the client, making sure to attach any plans from your drawing software.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3 o-contenteditable-false

ul.li: To dive deeper into the quote calculator, feel free to Learn more about its features and capabilities.
Redirect the emails sent to info@your-business.com to the CRM.
Use the Website app to create a contact form that will redirect all the requests to the CRM.
Want to make your quotes stand out? Try the PDF quote builder.
Don't worry, even if your customer changes their plan, all historical sales orders are saved in the chatter.

template.p: Confirming a quotation automatically creates a dedicated project in the Project app. Each new project comes with several default tasks to get you started.

The top bar of your project gives you quick access to all essential aspects, such as purchase orders, manufacturing orders, and invoices. You can also create new documents directly from the project app. For example, by clicking the "Purchase" button, you can create a new purchase order that will be automatically linked to your project and factored into its profitability.
In the Project app, you can:

li.p: Drag and drop tasks to different stages for easy tracking.
Record time on specific tasks (like "External Help"), and that time will be used to calculate your project's profitability.
View a profitability dashboard that gives you a clear overview of your project's financial performance once you've properly configured all costs from timesheets, production, and purchases.

ul.li: If your projects are diverse, you can create different project templates to suit your needs.

div.p: To avoid double-counting costs and ensure an accurate profitability dashboard, be careful with how you link expenses to your projects.

ul.li: If you are manually invoicing for timesheet hours from an external resource, do not also link those hours to the project in your system. This will prevent the costs from being counted twice on your profitability dashboard.

When purchasing components for a new product, you can create a purchase order that isn't directly linked to the project. Then, link only the receipt to the project. This gives you a clear overview of your purchases while ensuring the cost is counted just once.

template.p: Starting a construction project implies a lot of important documents such as contracts, building plans, instructions for use, subcontracting agreements, etc. Instead of scattering them in your emails, storage services or computer, attach them in the chatter and they will be automatically centralized in the Documents app.
Speed up the signing process thanks to the Sign app. Once again, all the signed documents will be stored in the Documents app.

Within the Project app, you can use the Purchase button to create all the purchases your project needs. You have the flexibility to deliver products to your production workshop or directly to the customer site using dropshipping. Additionally, if you need to subcontract any activities, you can add service products directly to your purchase lines.

li.p: Select the vendor and expected delivery date.
Add all the products or services you need to purchase.
For direct-to-client delivery, choose dropship delivery and select the customer's address.
Once confirmed, a receipt will be automatically generated, ready for you to confirm upon delivery.

template.p: The Manufacturing and Inventory app is designed to help you manage your in-house production and keep a close eye on the stock levels of your raw materials.
If you don't need to track inventory but still want to monitor costs, purchases, and production, you can simply disable the tracking option in the product settings.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

ul.li: Create a bill of materials (BOM) for each finished product.
Set the inventory route to "Manufacture" for all manufactured products.
Use a single generic product entry for custom finished products, using lots to distinguish between them.

template.p: To create a finished product, follow these steps:

ul.li: Generate a Manufacturing Order: Within your project, create a new Manufacturing Order. Add all the necessary components that will be used, whether they are from your current stock or are new costs.
Validate Production: Once you've completed the manufacturing process, validate the order to finalize it.

Create a Delivery Order: Go to the Project App and create a new "From WH" (Warehouse) operation. This acts as a delivery order, listing all the finished products that need to be taken from your stock and delivered to the customer.
Confirm Delivery: Once you validate this operation, the products will be automatically removed from your inventory, and the delivery can be completed.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3

li.p: Define Lead Times: Set lead times for all your products to ensure accurate stock planning.
Use the Replenishment Dashboard: Get a clear overview of exactly what you need to order.
Automate Replenishment: Set up reordering rules for key products so you never run out of stock.

ul.li: Manage By-Products: Use the by-products feature in the Manufacturing app to reuse any remaining product parts after a production run. This lets you track and manage leftover materials that are created during production, reducing waste and improving efficiency.

template.p: As the first invoicing step, create a down payment from the sales order. This will generate the first invoice in the Invoicing app. Then, schedule one or several "Invoicing Schedule" activities on the sales order with the aim to never forget to send an intermediary invoice in order to sustain your cash flow.
Before generating an intermediary invoice in the Invoicing app, freeze the project status in the Project app to get an overview on the progress in terms of:

ul.li: Time spent on the project.
Materials purchased.
Materials sold.

template.p: All these components will give you an accurate overview on the project profitability.
template.h1: Do you want to go further?
template.p: Enrich the core apps by installing the following ones.
Use the Planning app to organize the work of your employees. Define on which project and when they have to work. Easily manage shift conflicts, workload and replacements in case of leaves.

Increase your visibility and get more leads by creating a beautiful Website! When a potential customer sends a request through the contact form, it could automatically create an opportunity in the CRM app.
Use the Accounting app to easily handle:

ul.li: The customer reminders.
The vendor bills payment.
The synchronization with the banks.
The financial reporting.

template.p: A bigger workshop provides more space for machinery, materials, and a more efficient layout. This can significantly increase production capacity and improve workflow by reducing clutter and bottlenecks.

ul.li: Implement a real-time quality check. You can add quality checks for specific products at critical moments in the manufacturing process. This ensures that any defects are caught early, reducing waste and the cost of rework.

Use a shopfloor app. If you have a growing team, a digital shopfloor app can ensure that every employee receives the right information at the right time. It can provide work instructions, track progress, and facilitate communication, leading to smoother operations and fewer errors.

Manage product variations efficiently. To handle different versions of a product, such as a table made from various types of wood, you can use a product variant system. This allows you to reuse the same Bill of Materials (BOM) but with minor adjustments for different material types, saving time and preventing errors in inventory management and production planning.
